variant.name: NearbyShareBackgroundScanning
variant.summary: Background scanning for Nearby Share to detect and notify the user of devices nearby that are attempting to share

variant.name: NumberpadDynamicActivations
variant.summary: Turning on number pad mode for a dynamic numberpad.

variant.name: NumberpadDynamicCancellations
variant.summary: Turning off number pad mode for a dynamic numberpad, without having used a number-pad key.

variant.name: NumberpadDynamicEnterKeystrokes
variant.summary: Pressing enter on dynamic number pad.

variant.name: NumberpadDynamicNonEnterKeystrokes
variant.summary: Pressing key other than enter on dynamic number pad.

variant.name: NumberpadExternalEnterKeystrokes
variant.summary: Pressing number pad enter on external keyboard.

variant.name: NumberpadExternalNonEnterKeystrokes
variant.summary: Pressing number pad key other than enter on external keyboard.

variant.name: NumberpadInternalEnterKeystrokes
variant.summary: Pressing enter on number pad on internal keyboard.

variant.name: NumberpadInternalNonEnterKeystrokes
variant.summary: Pressing number pad key other than enter on internal keyboard.

variant.name: StylusDetachedFromDockSession
variant.summary: Time spent from stylus being undocked, to being re-docked

variant.name: StylusDetachedFromGarageOrDockSession
variant.summary: Time spent while either out of garage or un-docked

variant.name: StylusDetachedFromGarageSession
variant.summary: Time spent from stylus being removed from garage, to being replaced into garage

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Apps.ExternalProtocolDialog
histogram.summary: Records the response when the intent picker is shown to the user on Chrome OS to allow them to open an external protocol in an app.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Apps.ExternalProtocolDialog.Accepted
histogram.summary: Records the response when users that are shown the intent picker accept opening an external protocol in an app as well as whether the app is persisted.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Apps.ExternalProtocolDialog.Rejected
histogram.summary: Records the response when users that are shown the intent picker reject opening an external protocol in an app.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Apps.IntentPickerAction
histogram.summary: Records the response when the intent picker is shown to the user on Chrome OS to allow them to open a URL in an app.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Apps.IntentPickerDestinationPlatform
histogram.summary: Records the app platform chosen (or Chrome if the user did not choose an app) when the intent picker is shown to the user on Chrome OS. The destination may be specified due to the user explicit selection or a previously stored preference.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Apps.NumberOfAppsForNotification
histogram.summary: Records whether a notification matches multiple apps, when there is one or multiple web apps matching a web page nonpersistent notification.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Apps.OpenBrowser
histogram.summary: Records the type of app sending a link to the browser to be opened.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Attestation.AttestationFlowStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status of attestation flow. The value represents 6 flags in 6 rightmost bits; starting from more significant bits they mean: 1. Has proxy. 2. Is System proxy active. 3. Run the default flow. 4. The default flow succeeds. 5. Run the fallback flow. 6. The fallback flow succeeds.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Attestation.GetCertificateStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status of `AttesttionClient::GetCertificate()` called by `AttestationFlowIntegrated`.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.ConfigureStreams.Output.Resolution
histogram.summary: Records the resolution of output stream that is configured by Chrome OS camera service.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.ConfigureStreamsLatency
histogram.summary:
Records the process time of ConfigureStreams() method in Chrome OS camera service.
This metric is reported for all users and will not cause abnormal distribution since the metric is Chrome OS specified.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.ErrorType
histogram.summary: Records the type of the error which triggers the Notify() method in Chrome OS camera service.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.Facing
histogram.summary: Records the camera facing of the camera session in Chrome OS camera service.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.Jpeg.Latency
histogram.summary:
Records the process time of the JDA (Jpeg Decode Accelerator) or JEA (Jpeg Encode Accelerator) run on Chrome OS camera service. There are suffixes that record the runner method (hardware/software), the runner type (decode/encode).
This metric is reported for all users and will not cause abnormal distribution since the metric is Chrome OS specified.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.Jpeg.Resolution
histogram.summary: Records the resolution of the image that JDA/JEA process by Chrome OS camera service. The resolution represents by the total pixels contained in the image. There are suffixes that record the runner method (hardware/software), the runner type (decode/encode).

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.OpenDeviceClientType
histogram.summary: Records which client type (e.g., Chrome, Android) is opening a camera device.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.OpenDeviceLatency
histogram.summary:
Records the process time of OpenDevice() method in Chrome OS camera service.
This metric is reported for all users and will not cause abnormal distribution since the metric is Chrome OS specified.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.SessionDuration
histogram.summary: Records the session duration in Chrome OS camera service.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CertProvisioning.CsrSignTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took the certificate provisioning worker to sign a CSR. Emitted after the sign is complete.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CertProvisioning.Event
histogram.summary: Number of times each event is reached during the certificate provisioning flow.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CertProvisioning.KeypairGenerationTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took the certificate provisioning worker to generate one key pair. Emitted after the generation is complete.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CertProvisioning.Result
histogram.summary: For final states (see the list in cert_provisioning::IsFinalState): number of times the certificate provisioning worker finished on every state. For other states: number of times the worker failed on every state.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CertProvisioning.VaTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took the certificate provisioning worker to build one Verified Access response. Emitted after the response is built.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.CollectPerf
histogram.summary: A count of successes and various failure modes related to collecting and processing profile data obtained via "perf events" on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.CollectProcessTypes
histogram.summary: Record the collection status (success or failure) when the Chrome process and thread types are collected as part of the ChromeOS perf profile collection.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.JankinessTriggerStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status of collection attempts triggered by jankiness on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.ParseCPUFrequencies
histogram.summary: A count of successes and various failure modes related to the parsing of logical CPU frequencies on Chrome OS. Recorded when the browser process starts.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.ParsePSICPU
histogram.summary: A count of successes and various failure modes related to the parsing of PSI CPU data on Chrome OS. Recorded after each perf collection.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.RecordPerf
histogram.summary: A count of the various outcomes related to recording the profile data collected via "perf events" on Chrome OS. The histogram is recorded when system-wide CPU profiling finishes and the collected data is being saved to memory for later upload.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.UploadPerf
histogram.summary: Records the number of "perf events" reports included in an UMA upload on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.DeviceSettings.FeatureFlagsMigration
histogram.summary: Migration status for Chrome OS feature flags configuration in device settings. This is intended to track migration progress in the field, so the migration code can be removed when the old approach of storing bare flags is no longer relevant in the field.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.DiagnosticsUi.InitialScreen
histogram.summary: Records requested initial screen when opening the Diagnostics App.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.DiagnosticsUi.MemoryRoutineDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration that the Memory Routine took to complete. Emitted when the routine completes successfully.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.DiagnosticsUi.OpenDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration that the Diagnostics App is open. emitted when the app is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.DiagnosticsUi.RoutineCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of routines run while the Chrome OS Diagnostics App was open. Begins at zero each time the app is open and recorded each time the app is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.DiagnosticsUi.{RoutineType}Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of the {RoutineType} Routine.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.FamilyLink.ChildStatusReportRequest.Size
histogram.summary: Reports the size of the uploaded ChildStatusReportRequest proto in kilobytes. This metric records right before the report uploads. The max bucket value is 500MB.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.FamilyLink.ChildStatusReportRequest.TimeSinceLastReport
histogram.summary: Reports the time in between ChildStatusReportRequest uploads in minutes. The default upload frequency is once every ten minutes. This metric records right before the report uploads. The max bucket value is 100,000 minutes (1667 hours).

histogram.name: ChromeOS.FamilyLinkUser.LogSegment
histogram.summary: Categorizes the current user for the Family Experiences team's metrics. Other is for all other users that do not fall into any of the below categories. Users under the age of consent automatically have supervision applied to their accounts. Users over the age of consent can opt into supervision.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.FamilyUser.LogSegment
histogram.summary: Categorizes the current user for the Family Experiences team's metrics. Other is for all other users that do not fall into any of the below categories. A Supervised User has a supervised primary account and no secondary accounts. A Supervised Student has a supervised primary account and one or more EDU secondary accounts, which is the only available option for a secondary account in that scenario. A Student at Home has a K-12 EDU primary account on an unmanaged ChromeOS device, regardless of the secondary account.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.FamilyUser.LogSegment2
histogram.summary: Categorizes the current user for the Family Experiences team's metrics. Other is for all other users that do not fall into any of the below categories. A Supervised User has a supervised primary account and no secondary accounts. A Supervised Student has a supervised primary account and one or more EDU secondary accounts, which is the only available option for a secondary account in that scenario. A Student at Home has a K-12 EDU primary account on an unmanaged ChromeOS device, regardless of the secondary account. A Regular User is an unmanaged consumer user on any device. This metric is logged with every UMA upload in ProvideCurrentSessionData().

histogram.name: ChromeOS.FamilyUser.NumSecondaryAccounts
histogram.summary: Reports the number of secondary accounts besides the primary user. This metric is logged with every UMA upload in ProvideCurrentSessionData(). This metric is not reported for guest users.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.FeatureUsage.{FeatureName}
histogram.summary: Records device eligibility, enabled status, and success rate for the {FeatureName} feature. Different events are recorded at different times, as described in the enum labels.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.FeatureUsage.{FeatureName}.Usetime
histogram.summary: Records the duration of time (ms) a given {FeatureName} feature was used.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.GAIA.AuthenticatorContentWindowNull
histogram.summary: Whether the GAIA Authenticator unexpectedly encountered a null contentWindow value while handling WebView's onContentLoad event. This metric is only enabled for AuthMode = DEFAULT, which indicates ChromeOS online login. This is the only mode where the issue has been observed. Other modes not captured here are OFFLINE (offline ChromeOS login) and DESKTOP (for online GAIA login on desktop Chrome).

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Gaia.Message.{GaiaAuthFlow}.{MessageName}
ChromeOS.Gaia.PasswordFlow
histogram.summary: Records events for the Gaia password flow. "Started" is recorded on each password entry on the Gaia page. "Completed" is recorded when Gaia authentication succeeds. Note: this is not recorded for SAML flows.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.HardwareVerifier.Report
histogram.summary: Qualification status of each component types. This entry is generated by hardware_verifier.conf at boot time.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.HardwareVerifier.Report.IsCompliant
histogram.summary: Aggregated result of hardware verifier check.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.HardwareVerifier.TimeToFinish
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to finish one hardware verification run.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.HardwareVerifier.TimeToProbe
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to probe hardware components.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.IioService.SensorClientConcurrent
histogram.summary: Records the maximum number of concurrent sensor clients within an hour, which indicates how many apps are using sensors. Recorded once every hour. Might not be recorded for tail-end usage during a session.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.IioService.SensorObserver
histogram.summary: Records the maximum number of running observers within an hour to any sensor. It indicates how widely used the sensor samples are. Recorded once every hour. Might not be recorded for tail-end usage during a session.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.IioService.SensorObserverOpen
histogram.summary: Records the number of opened observer within an hour, which indicates how often sensors are enabled and disabled. Recorded once every hour. Might not be recorded for tail-end usage during a session.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.IioService.SensorUsage.{Frequency}Hz
histogram.summary: Records the usage of the sensor within an hour with at least {Frequency} Hz. Recorded once every hour. Might not be recorded for tail-end usage during a session.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.IsLacrosBrowser
histogram.summary: Recorded as part of the metrics session data to identify the lacros-chrome browser binary.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.KeyPermissionsManager.ArcUsageUpdate
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the arc usage flags update started as well as the number of times it succeeded and failed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.KeyPermissionsManager.ArcUsageUpdateTime
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to successfully update chaps with the new ARC usage flags.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.KeyPermissionsManager.Migration
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the migration started as well as the number of times it succeeded and failed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.KeyPermissionsManager.MigrationTime
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to successfully migrate key permissions to chaps.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Lacros.OSChannel
histogram.summary: The release channel of the Chrome OS system on which Lacros is running. May be different than the Lacros browser release channel. Recorded by the lacros binary shortly after startup.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Lacros.StartTime
histogram.summary: Time to start the lacros binary, specifically the time between when the process is launched and the mojo connection is established between ash and lacros. Recorded by ash each time the lacros binary is started.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.LanguagePacks.InstallComplete.Success
histogram.summary: Records whether a language pack installation was successful after a language pack installation attempt.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.LanguagePacks.UninstallComplete.Success
histogram.summary: Records whether a language pack uninstallation was successful after a language pack uninstallation attempt.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.LegacySupervisedUsers.HiddenFromLoginScreen
histogram.summary: Reports "hidden" when the login screen hides a legacy supervised user (LSU). Reports "displayed" when the login screen displays a non-LSU Gaia user. Reports "deleted" when the login screen attempts to delete a LSU. Recorded whenever the user sees the login screen.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Liveness.PingResponseTime
histogram.summary: Reports the time (ms) elapsed between sending of a LivenessChecker ping and receipt of the response. Recorded when LivenessChecker receives a ping response.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Logging.{LogType}EntryCountPerDay
histogram.summary: Metrics of the numbers of log entries recorded in {LogType}s. Recorded when the daily job "chromeos-cleanup-logs" is executed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Logging.{LogType}LogFileSizePerDay
histogram.summary: File sizes of {LogType} files in megabytes. Recorded when the daily job "chromeos-cleanup-logs" is executed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Logging.{LogType}MaxThroughputPerMin
histogram.summary: Metrics of the number of maximum throughput (entries per minute) recorded in {LogType}s within a day. Recorded when the daily job "chromeos-cleanup-logs" is executed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Logging.{LogType}TotalFileSize
histogram.summary: Total file sizes of {LogType} files in megabytes. Recorded when the daily job "chromeos-cleanup-logs" is executed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.MachineIdRegen.AgeSeconds
histogram.summary:
The number of seconds of uptime since the last time the Chrome OS machine-id was regenerated. This is reported every time the machine-id is regenerated except for the first time since reboot.
NB: Data before M90 is incomplete.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.MachineIdRegen.Lock
histogram.summary: Measures whether the MachineIdRegen script acquires the lock. Success / Fail is recorded every time the script is invoked. This is to test if the locking is working as expected.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.MachineIdRegen.Reason
histogram.summary:
The reason why the Chrome OS machine-id was regenerated. This is reported when the machine-id is re-generated.
NB: Data before M90 is incomplete.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.MemoryPressureLevel
histogram.summary: The memory pressure level in Chrome OS, which is recorded periodically (once per second). This is used to show the relative frequency of the system being in a critical vs relaxed memory pressure state.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.MessageCenter.ScrollActionReason
histogram.summary: The cause of the scroll event by the user on the message center. Only the first event after the message center opens is recorded. For example, the user opens the message center and scrolls by mouse then by key, only the mouse event is recorded. If the user closes and reopens the message center before the second event, both events are recorded.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.PlatformKeysService.{Operation}.{KeyType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the final result of performing {Operation} operation on an {KeyType} key in PlatformKeysService.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.PlatformVerification.Available
histogram.summary: Whether platform verification subsystem features are available at the time a platform verification request is made for content protection on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.PlatformVerification.BrowserResult
histogram.summary: The result of a platform verification attempt for content protection on Chrome OS, limited to the browser-specific checks. It's still possible for platform verification to fail at later layers.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.PlatformVerification.Result
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with pattern histogram ChromeOS.PlatformVerification.Result2. (2021-06 // M93).
histogram.summary: The result of a platform verification attempt for content protection on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.PlatformVerification.Result2
histogram.summary: The result of a platform verification attempt for content protection on Chrome OS. Does not include browser-related failures. Those are tracked in ChromeOS.PlatformVerification.BrowserResult.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.PrivacyScreen.Toggled
histogram.summary: Record when the user toggles the integrated privacy screen on/off. See the PrivacyScreenToggleUISurface enum for all UI surfaces for toggling the feature.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SAML.APILogin
histogram.summary: Records every online login authenticated purely with GAIA or with SAML.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SAML.InSessionPasswordChangeEvent
histogram.summary: Records how often users are guided through the SAML in-session password change flow, and how often it is completed succesfully.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SAML.InSessionPasswordSyncEvent
histogram.summary: Records how often password sync token API is called. Tracks results of token verify operation and API errors.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SAML.Provider
histogram.summary: Records SAML provider when SAML login flow is used.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SAML.SamlChallengeKeyHandlerResult
histogram.summary: Tracks results of calculating response for a challenge from Verified Access server for remove attestation during SAML authentication.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SAML.Scraping.PasswordCountAll
histogram.summary: The number of passwords that were scraped during a Chrome OS login via SAML. This is set only when the Chrome Credentials Passing API is not used.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SAML.Scraping.VerificationResult
histogram.summary: Whether one of the scraped passwords was successfully verified as the user's password. This is set only when the Chrome Credentials Passing API is not used.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SecurityAnomaly
histogram.summary:
Records when an event representing a deviation from the Chrome OS security posture happens.
Writable+executable mount events are checked every thirty seconds, but each anomalous event is reported only once per boot.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Accessibility.FullscreenMagnifierFocusFollowing
histogram.summary: Records when a user changes the kFullscreenMagnifierFocusFollowing setting on the Accessibility page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Accessibility.FullscreenMagnifierMouseFollowingMode
histogram.summary: Recorded when a user changes the value of the kFullscreenMagnifierMouseFollowingMode setting on the Accessibility page. Records the value of the setting.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Apps.DoNotDisturbOnOff
histogram.summary: Records when a user changes the kDoNotDisturbOnOff setting in the Notifications subpage of the Apps section.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Bluetooth.BluetoothOnOff
histogram.summary: Records when users change the kBluetoothOnOff setting on the Bluetooth page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.BlurredWindowDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time between when the settings window becomes blurred and when the user focuses it again.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Device.KeyboardFunctionKeys
histogram.summary: Records when a user changes the kKeyboardFunctionKeys setting on the Device page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Device.TouchpadSpeedValue
histogram.summary: Records when users change the Touchpad Speed on the Device page. The value saved is equal to the sensitivity value set on the slider, which ranges from 1 to 5.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Inputs.ShortcutReminderDismissed
histogram.summary: Records when users dismiss the shortcut reminder banner in Chrome OS' Inputs OS settings page. The value saved indicates the keyboard shortcuts that were previously shown in the banner before the user dismissed the banner.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Languages.Browser.Interaction
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of M88, as the languages browser settings page has been replaced with the languages OS settings page.
histogram.summary: Records when users interact with an element in the Chrome OS's Languages browser settings page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Languages.Browser.OfferToTranslateCheckbox
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of M88, as the languages browser settings page has been replaced with the languages OS settings page.
histogram.summary: Records when users check/uncheck "Offer to translate pages in this language" checkbox.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Languages.Browser.Toggle
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of M88, as the languages browser settings page has been replaced with the languages OS settings page.
histogram.summary: Records when users interact with a toggle in the Chrome OS's Languages browser settings page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Languages.Interaction
histogram.summary: Records when users interact with different element in the Chrome OS's Languages OS settings page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Languages.OfferToTranslateCheckbox
histogram.summary: Records when users check/uncheck "Offer to translate pages in this language" checkbox in OS Settings

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Languages.SupportPageVisits
histogram.summary: Records when users visit a language settings support page for Chrome OS.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Languages.Toggle
histogram.summary: Records when users interact with a toggle in the Chrome OS's Languages OS settings page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.LoadCompletedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the render frame host StartProvisionalLoad event and the render frame DocumentOnLoadCompleted event for the Chrome OS settings page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.LoadDocumentTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the render frame host StartProvisionalLoad and DidFinishDocumentLoad events for the Chrome OS settings page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.NotificationPage.PermissionOnOff
histogram.summary: Records when a user changes the notification permission of any app in the Notifications subpage of the Apps section.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.NumCharsOfQueries
histogram.summary: The number of characters for queries used to fetch results from the Settings Search Mojo API.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.NumClicksUntilChange
histogram.summary: The number of clicks before changing a setting.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.NumNavigationsUntilChange
histogram.summary: The number of navigations before changing a setting.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.NumSearchesUntilChange
histogram.summary: The number of searches before changing a setting.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.NumSearchResultsFetched
histogram.summary: The number of search results fetched each time a successful search request is made to the Settings Search Mojo API.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.OsBannerInteraction
histogram.summary: Records whether the "try your Chrome OS settings" banner was shown when the user opened a new Chrome browser settings tab and also records interactions with the banner.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.PathVisited
histogram.summary: Paths visited within chrome://os-settings. For evaluating popularity and priorities for OS Settings UI.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.People.AddAccountCount
histogram.summary: Records when users click the Add Account button on the People page. The number of the account that would be added is saved, e.g. a sample of 2 means the user entered the add account dialog for a 2nd account.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Privacy.PeripheralDataAccessProtection
histogram.summary: Records when the users clicks on the Peripheral Data Access toggle. A true value refers to the user enables peripheral data access protection (toggle is turned on).

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SearchLatency
histogram.summary: The time fetching search results from the Settings Search Mojo API. Recorded when getSearchHandler().search() completes.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SearchRequests
histogram.summary: The number of search requests made to the Settings Search Mojo API. For search requests that succeeded with a response, the number of search requests that had results which were discarded, and the number of search requests that were shown to the user. Recorded when getSearchHandler().search() completes.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SearchRequestsPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of search requests made to the Settings Search Mojo API in one session of the settings app.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SearchResultSectionSelected
histogram.summary: Section search results clicked by user in the OS settings search box.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SearchResultSettingSelected
histogram.summary: Setting search results clicked by user in the OS settings search box.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SearchResultSubpageSelected
histogram.summary: Subpage search results clicked by user in the OS settings search box.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SearchResultTypeSelected
histogram.summary: Type of search results clicked by user in the OS settings search box.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SettingChanged
histogram.summary: Records the the setting id when the user changes a setting. Note that some of the values of the OsSetting enum aren't strictly settings (such as kKeyboardShortcuts, which is just a hyperlink). All of the recorded values appear in the settings page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.TimeUntilChange
histogram.summary: The time spent on the settings page before changing a setting.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.UserActionOnSearchResultsShown
histogram.summary: The user action taken when search results exist and are displayed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Wifi.AddNetwork
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user adds a WiFi network that has not been added before.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Wifi.Hidden
histogram.summary: Recorded when the "Hidden" Wi-Fi network toggle is changed by the user.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.WindowOpenDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time between when a Chrome OS settings window is opened and when it is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.AppCount
histogram.summary: Records number of apps found for a given intent in the Sharesheet.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.AppCount.{AppType}
histogram.summary: Records number of {AppType} apps found for a given intent in the Sharesheet when the sharesheet is invoked.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.AppCount2.{AppType}
histogram.summary:
Records number of {AppType} apps found for a given intent in the Sharesheet when the sharesheet is invoked. Has 100 exponential buckets. (The original histogram had 1000 linear buckets).
Warning: this histogram was expired from M95 to M96; data may be missing.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.FileCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of files a user is trying to share from the Sharesheet when the sharesheet is invoked.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.FormFactor
histogram.summary: Records the form factor when the Sharesheet is invoked.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.IsDriveFolder
histogram.summary: If the value is true, the data being shared from the Sharesheet is a folder from Drive. Recorded when the sharesheet is invoked.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.IsImagePreviewPressed
histogram.summary: If the value is true, the image preview was pressed during the current invocation. Recorded when the sharesheet closes.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.LaunchSource
histogram.summary:
Records the source from which the Sharesheet is invoked.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M95 to M96; data may be missing.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.ShareActionCount
histogram.summary:
Records each action found for a given intent when the Sharesheet is invoked.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M95 to M96; data may be missing.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.UserAction
histogram.summary: Records user action on sharesheet invocations.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sync.PreferencesMigrated
histogram.summary: Tracks whether browser sync preferences were migrated to the new OS sync feature (project SplitSettingsSync). Recorded once per session during login.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Tracks the animation smoothness for the collapse / expand animation of the system tray.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.BlockedNotifiersAfterUpdate
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of blocked notifiers in the system tray after the user blocks one or multiple notifiers. Note that this metric records the number of blocked notifiers *after* the update.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.BlockedNotifiersOnOpen
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of blocked notifiers in the system tray when it is opened.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.FeaturePodCountOnOpen
histogram.summary: The number of feature pods (e.g. WiFi, Bluetooth, IME, Accessibility, etc.) in the system tray quick settings when it is opened, including pods that overflow to other pages. See ChromeOS.SystemTray.Tablet.FeaturePodCountOnOpen for the corresponding histogram logged in tablet mode.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.FirstInteraction
histogram.summary: Records the first interaction the user has with the system tray, which can be a click/tap on the quick settings or message center bubble. Note that this interaction could be at any time after the user opens the tray (e.g. 30 seconds later before the first click).

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.Interaction
histogram.summary: An enum value how system tray bubble is interacted e.g. by tap (touch screen), or click (mouse, trackpad, etc.) Reported every time the region inside system tray bubble is tapped or clicked.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.IsExpandedOnOpen
histogram.summary: If the value is true, SystemTray is expanded when it's opened. Otherwise, it's closed when it's opened.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.NotificationsRemovedByClearAll
histogram.summary: Records the number of notifications that are removed in a single clear all action by the user.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.OpenHelpPageForManaged
histogram.summary: Type of the support page which user opened by clicking the indicator of managed device type in the unified system tray bubble.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.ShelfPodCount
histogram.summary: The number of status area item pods (e.g. IME, Palette, Dictation, etc.) in the shelf status area whenever a pod appears/disappears. This histogram is only logged when the device is not in tablet mode, otherwise ChromeOS.SystemTray.Tablet.ShelfPodCount is logged.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.Tablet.FeaturePodCountOnOpen
histogram.summary: The number of feature pods (e.g. WiFi, Bluetooth, IME, Accessibility, etc.) in the system tray quick settings when it is opened, including pods that overflow to other pages. This histogram is only logged when the device is in tablet mode, otherwise ChromeOS.SystemTray.FeaturePodCountOnOpen is logged.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.Tablet.ShelfPodCount
histogram.summary: The number of status area item pods (e.g. IME, Palette, Dictation, etc.) in the shelf status area whenever a pod appears/disappears. This histogram is only logged when the device is in tablet mode, otherwise ChromeOS.SystemTray.ShelfPodCount is logged.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.TimeToClick
histogram.summary: The amount of time a user took from clicking on the button in status area, to clicking on an item in the system tray bubble. (Obsolete M90 onwards).

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.TimeToClick2
histogram.summary: The amount of time a user took after opening the system tray bubble, to clicking on an item in the system tray bubble.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.ToggleExpanded
histogram.summary: An enum value how system tray bubble is expanded or collapsed. It can be toggled by the button and touch gesture.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.TypeC.CableSpeed
histogram.summary: This value represents the speed of the USB Type-C cable which is connected to a device. It is recorded every time a new peripheral is connected.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.TypeC.PartnerType
histogram.summary: This value represents the type of a USB Type-C peripheral (the Partner) which is connected to a device. It is recorded every time a new peripheral is connected.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.TypeC.WrongConfiguration
histogram.summary: This value represents events where a USB Type-C peripheral couldn't be configured correctly, or experienced some other unexpected behaviour. It is recorded every time a new peripheral is connected.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.UrlXattrsCount
histogram.summary: The number of files with URL extended attributes found in the users' home directories. This is emitted once per boot. See crbug.com/919486 and crbug.com/939386 for more details.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.USB.DeviceAttached
histogram.summary: Timing and number of USB devices attached.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.UserAddingScreen.LoadTime
histogram.summary: The time spent before the web UI vesion of the multiprofile account picker is ready.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.UserAddingScreen.LoadTimeViewsBased
histogram.summary: The time spent before the views-based version of the multiprofile account picker is ready.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.UserTypeByDeviceType.LogSegment
histogram.summary: This value is reported at the start of a user session, and is a 32-bit value that reports the primary user account type and the device type (umanaged user on managed device, K12 user on an education device, etc.). The upper 16-bits represent the device type (found at http://shortn/_3iFWcdjy0P), and the lower 16-bits represent the user type (found at http://shortn/_uK3ZM4pC0a). So a nonprofit user (0x03) on an enterprise device (0x02) would be 0x00020003 or 131075.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.WebAPK.MinterResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: HTTP response code or net error code for requests made to the WebAPK minter service. Logged after a request to generate a WebAPK finishes, which happens when a PWA which supports Web Share Target is installed or updated.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.WebAPK.UnlinkedWebAPKCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of installed WebAPKs that were not linked to a Web App which were found and removed. The presence of these apps indicates that something went wrong in the WebAPK installation process. Unlinked apps are detected every startup, this histogram is only recorded when at least 1 app is found.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.WebAPK.{InstallType}.ArcInstallResult
histogram.summary: Records the detailed result when WebAPK is installed through ARC. A WebAPK is generated and installed when a PWA which supports Web Share Target is installed in the browser, and updated when the PWA's manifest updates. This histogram records successes/errors in the last step of the WebAPK {InstallType} process, when the generated WebAPK is installed in ARC.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.WebAPK.{InstallType}.Result
histogram.summary: Records the overall final state of a WebAPK {InstallType} operation on ChromeOS. A WebAPK is generated and installed when a PWA which supports Web Share Target is installed in the browser, and updated when the PWA's manifest updates.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.WXMountCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of writable+executable mounts on the system. The count itself is updated every 30 seconds, but this metric is reported every two hours of runtime. This metric is reported regardless of whether users are logged in or not. This metric is only reported on Chrome OS.
